content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Regular expression to match Julia code blocks
    pattern = r"```julia[^\n]*\n([\s\S]+?)\n```"m
    # Use a capturing group to capture the content of each code block
    captures = filter(x -> !isempty(x), map(match -> match.captures[1], eachmatch(pattern, md)))
    # Join the captures together with a newline
    code_blocks = join(captures, "\n")
    return code_blocks
end
```

This function uses a regular expression to find all instances of ````julia` code blocks in the markdown document. It then filters out any matches that do not contain any content (i.e., are empty) and joins the remaining captures together with a newline character.
